clues.text: It means capable of using both hands equally well, though a news report dubbed an MLB Lefty/righty pitcher "amphibious"
If your pulse races thinking of the Estelon Aura loudspeaker, you're this type of enthusiast
The ATF has a webpage on "rules &" these, which, actually, are also rules
This plural word means the science of flight & is the first "A" in NASA
To joke in a way others may find inappropriate, like me saying you have too much money, I'm taking back $3,000 each; I'm being...
This chain's to-go offerings aren't limited to items like the Meatzza pizza; it's also got Loaded Tots
This Mexican grill lists the 53 ingredients it uses, & yes, one of them is the chili pepper it's named for
This chain advises looking for its hot light to know when its original glazed doughnuts are, y'know, hot
Beijing Beef & Honey Walnut Shrimp are on the menu of this place that puns, "We wok for you"
You can get soup or mac & cheese in a bread bowl from this place with a name from Latin for "bread basket"
Prospero says, "We are such stuff as" these "are made on, and our little life is rounded with a sleep"
Prospero freed this spirit who was magically bound to a tree & used him to create the storm that sinks the ship
This daughter of Prospero was but 3 years old when she was set adrift in a boat with her father
Prospero threatens pain for this subordinate, son of the sorceress Sycorax: "Each pinch more stinging than bees that made 'em"
Prospero was once the duke of this Italian city, but his brother did him dirty

rounds.comments: You'll need to name the two shows whose titles we've combined.

clues.text: Prohibition comes to Colorado: "Boardwalk Park"

They came together in an "Emmy-Winning Episode":
"Modern Guy"

From L.A.'s Westside to Oklahoma:
"Curb Your Dogs"

Freedom for a new musical star:
"Prison Idol"

Kidman & Harrelson, together at last:
"Big Little Detective"
Usually known by its first 4 letters, it's a protective canvas covering that's been waterproofed
From the name of a British author, this adjective can describe a totalitarian state
This adjective with a pair of F's in the middle can refer to something that's not possible to put in words
It's the chemical compound in chili peppers that brings the heat
It's another word for upper case, like all the letters in the clue you're looking at
In May 1846, the first major clash of the Mexican War took place over disputed territory between the Nueces River & this other waterway
In 1928 this future president taught at an elementary school in Cotulla to earn money to continue his education
This high-end retailer opened in Dallas in 1907; in 2024, it was bought by the parent company of Saks Fifth Avenue
The first Native Amer. leaders tried for a raid in U.S. courts had attacked this 2-word caravan of vehicles in Young County in 1871
First name of Mr. Stilwell, who was inspired by spirits called brownies to develop the Texas gulf coast "Port" named for him
The chemist who "discovered" this writing implement opined in a 2009 memoir, "Yellow is still the only good color"
Pilot pen co.'s 1973 patent for ink "erased by light wiping" led to an increase in the use of these now-common writing surfaces
That little number on your pencil refers to hardness - how much of the "lead" is made of this vs. clay
Ancient Greeks used these implements for writing on parchment; you may have used a modern version like the Apple Pencil
In 1910 German pen-trepreneurs trademarked this brand name for writing instruments of "peak" quality
The young 'uns are familiar with the Cocomelon version of this classic that mentions a pig, a cow & the various noises they make
In this tune Bob Seger sang, "Today's music ain't got the same soul"
A nostalgic Macklemore song says, "I wish somebody would have told me... someday, these would be" these
The title of this Four Tops song precedes the lyric "but with a different meaning since you been gone"
Rod Stewart told us that this title object "been broke a thousand times"

"360" CNN journalist &
a parachuting hijacker

A British scientist
&
the quarterback for the Carolina Panthers during their 2016 Super Bowl appearance

"The World Is Flat" New York Times columnist
&
an economist who wrote "Capitalism & Freedom"

A World War II U.S. general
&
a Knick turned U.S. senator from New Jersey

Writer of "Prince Caspian"
&
a former congressman & SNCC leader
A term in the news in 2025, this was the title of the highest authority in Venice, an elected job with life tenure
The Vikings ranged from Russia in the east to Newfoundland in the west, which they called this
In 1347, after an 11-month siege, the Burghers of this city surrendered to the British; Rodin cast them in bronze 500 years later
We should perhaps call this king of England "the Conquered" since he lost the throne at the Battle of Hastings
The word "dunce" comes from the name of this medieval philosopher because he became associated with pointless hairsplitting
Under Robert's Rules, if you propose a motion, someone has to do this for the motion to be considered
From a Latin word meaning "of the world", this adjective means not connected with religion
A thought expressing an opinion based on incomplete evidence, or a business risk with not great odds
A professional who installs all kinds of pipes & makes sure they go snugly together
This kind of persuasion works below the threshold of conscious perception
Since 2006 this coin has featured an image from a Rembrandt Peale portrait as part of its "Return to Monticello" theme
Washington was on the front & a colonial drummer & victory torch on the reverse of a special quarter that came out in this year
This Midwest state's commemorative quarter features an astronaut, an early airplane & the words "Birthplace of Aviation Pioneers"
The American Women Quarters Program begun in 2022 has featured Wilma Mankiller, first female chief of this indigenous people
The U.S. Mint issued a 5-ounce silver coin in 2013 honoring this fort alluded to in our national anthem

rounds.text: Some 200 years after her birth, she was awarded the rank of General in Maryland's National Guard on Veterans Day 2024
